article_title: Concierge medicine: Like having a doctor on speed dial
article_text:
Once considered only for the wealthy, it’s attracting more doctors and patients

Concierge practices have grown 36 percent in recent years

Many patients turning to service because of ‘hamster wheel’ of modern medicine

article_metadata.title: Concierge medicine: Like having a doctor on speed dial | The Sacramento Bee

og.description: When Tamara Houston’s daughter developed a painful eye condition – on a Sunday, during a high school rodeo competition – the Yuba City mom didn’t rush to the emergency room or head to the nearest urgent care clinic. Instead, Houston picked up her cellphone and called her family’s primary care doctor, who met them two hours later at his Rocklin office. He diagnosed a scratched upper eyelid and recommended over-the-counter eyedrops to let it heal.
